metadata.subject: Roy Rep, el main de Dubai Para apostar por Posorja

relationships.description: Sultan of Dubai meeting with Ecuador's president to discuss investment in Posorja port
DPW interested in taking shares from Maerks naviera that was part of Alimport
Presidents planning official visit to strengthen alliance

transactions: Property sales in Dubai ranging from $15-45 million
Ecuador-Dubai trade of $2.5 million exported Jan-Jul 2013

analysis.purpose: To report on Dubai business leader's visit to Ecuador and potential major port investment
analysis.significance: Documents significant international business interest in Ecuador's port infrastructure and political-business relationships

concerns: Permit revocation for Alimport port project
Political challenges to Carlos Ochoa's nomination

notable_quotes: "Ahi la Subsecretaria (de Puertos) cometió un error -al revocarle el permiso de construcción a Alimport-"
"Hay que ser millonario para tener una propiedad en Dubai. The World es un conjunto de islotes formados de palmeras con forma de mapamundi."
"Es un Estado islámico, pero moderado, donde se juega un torneo anual de tenis que reparte 1,4 millones en premios"
red_flags: Permit revocation controversy for major infrastructure project

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this business/news article

details: Article references EXPRESO newspaper as source
Mentions media coverage of political and business events

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a published newspaper article about international business investments and political relations

analysis.summary: This news article reports on the visit of Dubai business leader Ahmed bin Sulayem to Ecuador to discuss potential investment in the Posorja deep-water port project with President Rafael Correa, while also covering Dubai's business environment and Ecuador's political developments.
